subject: Nutrition
title: Probiotics and Prebiotics
description: A quick, practical guide to Probiotics and Prebiotics.

hook.text: Yogurt ads promise probiotics will fix your gut. The truth is far more nuanced than that.

buildup.text: Probiotics are live bacteria in food or supplements. Prebiotics are fibers that feed existing bacteria.

discovery.text: Most probiotic supplements don't survive stomach acid long enough to colonize the gut permanently.

twist.text: Prebiotics from garlic, onions, and bananas may be more effective than pills at improving gut health.

climax.text: The most reliable way to support gut bacteria is eating a high-fiber, varied dietâ€”not supplements.

punchline.text: Feed the bacteria you have instead of buying new ones.

quiz.question: What are prebiotics?
options: Fibers that feed existing gut bacteria
